intro: Aponoa repens, commonly known as the creeping aponoa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that root at the nodes. Its small, white to pink flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Aponoa repens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
